movies.title: Le naufrage du Pamir
movies.plot: 's two-part drama focuses on the 1957 sinking of the Pamir, a German sailing ship, from the angle of three crew members. After his wife's death, former sailor Acki Lüders decides to sign up on the Pamir, whose first officer is his good friend Hans Ewald. As Captain Ludwig Lewerenz's ways of treating and educating the young crew are very strict, the three men have an often strained relationship. When the shipping company puts pressure on Lewerenz after problems in Bueno Aires, he decides to sail although the ship isn't stable...
movies.simplePlot: The Story of the German Sail-School Ship Pamir that sunk in a hurricane.

biography.bio: Klaus J. Behrendt was born on February 7, 1960 in Hamm, Germany as Klaus Johannes Behrendt. He is an actor, known for Tatort (1970), A.S. (1995) and Coming Home (2003).
biography.name: Klaus J. Behrendt

biography.bio: Miroslav Milanovic Miki was born on March 25, 1983 in Ruma, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He is known for his work on Munich (2005), The Heir Apparent: Largo Winch (2008) and Troy (2004). He has been married to Nina Milanovic since January 15, 2011.
biography.name: Miroslav Milanovic Miki

biography.placeOfBirth: Dresden, East Germany [now Saxony, Federal Republic of Germany]
biography.bio: Jan Josef Liefers was born on August 8, 1964 in Dresden, East Germany. He is an actor and director, known for Paradis express (1997), Tatort (1970) and The Baader Meinhof Complex (2008). He has been married to Anna Loos since August 5, 2004. They have two children. He was previously married to Aleksandra Tabakova.
biography.name: Jan Josef Liefers

biography.bio: Dietmar Bär was born on February 5, 1961 in Dortmund, Germany. He is an actor, known for Tatort (1970), Guys and Balls (2004) and Kehrtwende (2011). He has been married to Maren Geißler since April 15, 2009.
biography.name: Dietmar Bär

biography.bio: Karlos Klaumannsmoller is an Spanish actor. He was born in Tenerife, Canary Islands, Spain, His mother, Pura Mora, is An Spanish businesswoman, and his father, Carsten Klaumannsmoller is also a german businessman living in Hamburg. He has German, Spanish and Judish ancestry. He went to several schools during his childhood in the Canary Islands, and after he went to Los Cristianos Hight School. After leaving, he attended The Canary Islands Drama School in 1994. In 1996 Karlos went to England to work in a stage production. In 2001 he moved back to Spain. He has done many projects on stage and off, but most people recognize him from his work on severals Spanish television series, "La Que se avecina, Guante Blanco, 90 60 90 Diario de una adolescente" or during his participation in the local TV channel from the Canary Islands 'shows, " Somos como somos, ¿De qué lado estás?". This gave him his first big break through in the television industry. He has done a lot of work on the theatrical stage having played comedies and classicals characters. La Guerra de los sexos (2015-2017), Don Juan Tenorio (2012-2014), Los Críticos (2010-2012) or En alta Mar (2008). For this last play, he won 2 awards as Best actor. He has also appeared in films projects such as El juador de ajedrez, Stop over in hell (2017), EL Barranco del infierno, El Vuelo del Guirre. As well as acting, he has also written and produced short movies, radio Shows theatre plays. His first international break came from when he played a very small part in Der untergang der Pamir (ARD). Since then, he has also starred in many adds and tv series in Europe and USA.
biography.name: Karlos Klaumannsmoller

biography.bio: Peter Becker is an actor, known for Unknown (I) (2011), 13 Minutes (2015), Bis nichts mehr bleibt (2010). Although he spent most of his childhood growing up in England, Peter Becker first emerges on the stage at age 15 in Germany at the renowned Bad Hersfeld theatre festival. At the same time he begins building a background in journalism, rising to editor of the 'Hersfelder Zeitung' newspaper's weekly youth page and managing content for a radio station. After completing his formal education, he moves to Berlin, where he becomes a reputable production assistant and casting director for commercials and music videos. In 2002 he begins studying at the prestigious Academy of Dramatic Arts 'Ernst Busch' in Berlin. During this time the film and theatre industry begins to recognize his talents and he is recruited for his first film roles (including 'Der Untergang der Pamir', directed by Kaspar Heidelbach), and theatre engagements (at Deutsches Theater Berlin and Thalia Theater Hamburg). The short film 'Es geht uns gut' by Thomas Stuber, on which he worked both as lead actor as well as co-author, wins the Advancement Award of the film industry of Baden-Wuerttemberg in 2006 and receives the title "valuable" by the Film Review Board Wiesbaden in 2007. In addition to working in front of the camera (including 'Mission to murder Hitler', 'Until Nothing Remains', 'Unknown') he starts utilizing his wit to write scripts and produce content. From 2006 to 2007, Peter is a cast member at Volkstheater in Vienna, where he meets director Nuran David Calis, with whom he collaborates again in 2008 at the Schauspielhaus Cologne. In 2009, he returns to Berlin, and performs under the direction of Nurkan Erpulat as well as numerous productions at Ballhaus Naunynstrasse and Heimathafen Neukölln. In addition to his work as an actor, Peter Becker hosts live events such as the 'Achtung Berlin!' Film Festival, performs readings (at Literaturhaus Berlin amongst others), works as a voice-over artist (including Deutschlandradio Kultur, ARTE, ARD, ZDF etc.).
biography.name: Peter Becker

biography.bio: Volker Bruch was born on March 9, 1980 in Munich, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Reader (2008), The Baader Meinhof Complex (2008) and Young Goethe in Love (2010).
biography.name: Volker Bruch

biography.bio: Peter Clös was born on January 9, 1956 in Biedenkopf, Hesse, Germany. He is an actor, known for The Name of the Rose (1986), Der Schatten (1979) and Fools (2003).
biography.name: Peter Clös

biography.bio: Ciro de Chiara was born in 1967 in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, West Germany. He is an actor, known for Croupier (1998), Train Birds (1998) and Die Bubi Scholz Story (1998).
biography.name: Ciro de Chiara

biography.bio: Johanna Gastdorf was born in 1959 in Hamburg, Germany. She is an actress, known for Sophie Scholl: The Final Days (2005), Le miracle de Berne (2003) and The Wave (2008). She is married to Jan-Gregor Kremp. They have one child.
biography.name: Johanna Gastdorf

biography.bio: Ulrike Grote was born on July 8, 1963 in Bremen, West Germany. She is an actress and director, known for Die Kirche bleibt im Dorf - Die Serie (2013), Was wenn der Tod uns scheidet? (2008) and Die Kirche bleibt im Dorf (2012).
biography.name: Ulrike Grote

biography.bio: Lars Gärtner was born on September 20, 1974 in Essen, North Rhine-Westphalia, West Germany. He is an actor, known for The Experiment (2001), Stromberg (2004) and Zwischen Nacht und Tag (2004). He was previously married to Katharina Schubert.
biography.name: Lars Gärtner

biography.bio: Florian Jahr was born on June 23, 1983 in Berlin, Germany. He is an actor, known for Solo (2005), L'école de l'amour (2003) and Girl's Life, Boy's World (2003).
biography.name: Florian Jahr

biography.bio: Christian Kahrmann started his acting career at the early age of 8. Born in Cologne, Germany he starred in numerous movies and series till the age of 13, when he landed one of the leading parts in Germany's oldest (and still running) series 'Lindenstrasse' in 1985, which brought him nation-wide popularity over night. In 1993 Kahrmann left the series after 7 ½ years and decided to set forth his work in new projects that became famous in Germany like 'Und Tschüss!', 'Das ist Dein Ende', 'Tatort: Bildersturm', 'Victor-Der Schutzengel' and recently 'Ratten - Sie werden Dich kriegen!' which earned the highest ratings of the year for its broadcasting station Pro7. German Moviegoers remember him well from feature cult-classics like 'The first Semester' or 'Bang, Boom, Bang!' (aka 'Underdogs'). In 1995 Kahrmann moved to New York where he studied acting at the renowned Herbert Berghoff-Studio with Salem Ludwig and Edward Morehouse. In 1996 he joined with his fellow students Ronald Marx and Jarreth Merz to found 'German Theater Abroad, Inc.', a New York based production company that seeks to produce and promote contemporary German drama in English translation on American territory. Kahrmann now commutes between Berlin and New York and is currently working on new feature films and for the theatre in Germany.
biography.name: Christian Kahrmann

biography.bio: Marlon Kittel was born on December 11, 1983 in Essen, Germany. He is an actor, known for Paule and Julia (2002), Deux amis (2001) and Summer Storm (2004).
biography.name: Marlon Kittel
